SENT.plain: This paper describes an Australian of Caucasian descent with severe Moyamoya disease
She presented at the age of 34 with a subarachnoid haemorrhage
Between the ages of 45 and 48 she had multiple episodes of cerebrovascular ischaemia
Anastomotic surgery was carefully considered but not undertaken
Ten year follow up showed her to be extremely well without any further episodes of cerebrovascular disease
Accordingly it is recommended that surgery is probably not necessary in some cases, particularly in adults
